title: Solomon Kane: The Complete Tales
description: Solomon Kane (Suleyman Kehani as mentioned by Howard in one of his adventures) is a fictional character created by the pulp-era writer Robert E. Howard. A late 16th / early 17th century Puritan, Solomon Kane is a sombre-looking man who wanders the world with no apparent goal other than to vanquish evil in all its forms. His adventures, published mostly in the pulp magazine Weird Tales, often take him from Europe to the jungles of Africa and back.Howard described him as a somber and gloomy man of pale face and cold eyes, all of it shadowed by a slouch hat. He is dressed entirely in black and his weaponry consists of a rapier, a cutlass, and a brace of flintlock pistols. This collection contains all of the stories Howard wrote about this popular and enigmatic character, including:Red ShadowsSkulls in the StarsRattle of BonesThe Moon of SkullsHills of the DeadThe Footfalls WithinWings in the NightBlades of the BrotherhoodThe Right Hand of DoomSolomon Kane's Homecoming (a poem)Look for other Trilogus Classics collections, including Conan the Cimmerian, a collection of all the Conan stories written by Robert E, Howard.
